instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't run on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
pin 1 - 0V
2- 16.5V
3 - 3.95V
12 - 3.48V
13- 3.48V
14- 0V
15- 0V
17- 0.625V
19 - .5V dropping 
20- .5V dropping
diode drop on pin 19/20 is .457
27 - 0.41V
resistance 17/18 = 2.6 ohms, 27/28 =20.4 ohms
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - dropping toward zero 0.98V
PPBUS diode to ground = .431V

Changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> twice with same readings

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't run on charger only, runs on battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't run on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: Ok changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>. Pin 1 is now 16.5V the other readings are same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't run on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
"Pin 1 is now 16.5V"
You had correct 0V before; what happened???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't run on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
Not sure! Maybe it was there before and I didn’t have my lead up on pin 1 well. I only changed the one chip and nothing else. Didn’t poke around much while connected to power to have shorted anything.

 On other charger circuits I’ve seen ~16V before on pin 1 occasionally does that usually imply bad isl? also Does the isl produce the voltage at 19,20 and 27? Obviously I struggle to understand schematics. I have difficulty at time identifying what are inputs vs outputs unless it specifically says right on the pin of chip in schematic

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't run on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: Post now basic voltages for <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
